title: "Undefined variable: performance" in react-dom for Opera Mini browsers
body:
<!--
  Note: if the issue is about documentation or the website, please file it at:
  https://github.com/reactjs/reactjs.org/issues/new
-->

**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**

_bug_

**What is the current behavior?**

When loading `babel-polyfill` before `react` and `react-dom`, my site breaks with the following error only in the proxy mobile browser Opera Mini when in [extreme turbo](https://www.opera.com/turbo) mode. 

```
ReferenceError: Undefined variable: performance at h (https://<CDN>/16.2.0/react-dom.production.min.js:162)
```

Here's the catch, when `babel-polyfil` is loaded *after* `react` and `react-dom` the page loads as it does in other browsers when JS is switched off. This is the expected behaviour for this browser.

The problem with this issue is that I only have access to the error logs from production via a beacon. I haven't been able to view any console logs  from running in the browser directly, and haven't been able to replicate it in any web editors since those sites just completely don't work in Opera Mini.

I believe the error is referencing code here: https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/1673485720d9ac172fcf1f8628a004a4990bf4f4/packages/react-scheduler/src/ReactScheduler.js#L52

Sorry if this is posted in the wrong place, I'm not 100% sure where I should report this since it's relating to a proxy browser that doesn't run JS on the client. 

**What is the expected behavior?**

When loading `babel-polyfill` before `react` and `react-dom`, the site will render as if it would in any other browser with JS switched off.

**Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?**

I'm seeing this behaviour only in Opera Mini on Android and iOS when in [extreme turbo](https://www.opera.com/turbo) mode.
